conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to determine the speed of the bullet relative to the ground.

premise: The bullet is fired from Cart A with a speed \( v_0 \) relative to Cart A. Since Cart A is moving to the left with a speed \( v_1 \).
conclusion: The speed of the bullet relative to the ground (Cart A + track) will be: \( v_{\text{bullet}} = v_0 - v_1 \)

premise: Cart B is moving to the right with a speed \( v_2 \). The bullet hits the target on Cart B after traveling a distance \( s \) horizontally.
conclusion: The time taken for the bullet to travel this distance is: \( t = \frac{s}{v_0} \)

premise: During this time, Cart B moves a distance \( v_2 t \).
conclusion: The distance Cart B moves is: \( d_B = v_2 t = v_2 \frac{s}{v_0} \)

premise: Since the bullet hits the target on Cart B, the position of the target relative to Cart A must match the position of the bullet relative to Cart A after the same time \( t \).
conclusion: The relative speed of the bullet with respect to Cart B is: \( v_{\text{relative}} = v_0 - v_2 \)

premise: The bullet travels a distance \( s \) horizontally while Cart B moves a distance \( v_2 t \).
conclusion: The relative speed of the bullet with respect to Cart B is: \( v_{\text{relative}} = v_0 - v_2 \)

premise: Since the bullet hits the target on Cart B, the relative speed of the bullet with respect to Cart B must equal the speed of Cart B relative to the ground.
conclusion: Thus, we have: \( v_0 - v_2 = v_2 \)

premise: Thus, we have: \( v_0 - v_2 = v_2 \)
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is: \( v_0 = 2v_2 \)
conclusion: The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is: \( \boxed{v_0} \)
